ComicInfo.Title: Requiem for an Acidhead; What Is a Criminal; Acid Revolution; Art the Party Crasher; If Everyone Dropped Just One Little Tab...; Pot Party; Nation of Addicts!; A Word from Our Sponsor; Modern Youth in Crisis; Ode to Pigs; Timothy Leary Encounters Alfred Jarry in Heaven; Awe's id Fears; Michael from Mountains: An Acid-Age Romance; The Happy Couple Take Acid; Somewhere in the Future; I Am the Pontiac!; Louie Burns His Burgers; Annie Danow Takes a Trip; Thrilling Episodes of Sudden Illumination!; Back Home in Pasadena on Acid; Hands Off Tim Leary; Beyond th' Call o' Duty; My First LSD Trip
ComicInfo.Summary:
Out in nature while on acid.
Hearing the news that Timothy Leary was arrested in Afghanistan.
Who is the real criminal?
Improving the world after the acid revolution.
Touting the benefits of insanity over living by logic.
Art falls off his ladder and literally crashes into a party.
A daughter touting to her parents the benefits of LSD.
Trying out Jamaican weed, cocaine and heroin at a party.
Detailing the perils of that killer beverage- coffee.
A TV commercial touting LSD.
Timothy encounters Alfred fishing by a riverfront.
Notable events in the usage of LSD from its creation to Timothy Leary's arrest.
Trina's account of a romance at Millbrook.
The couple take acid.
The cat takes revenge because the litter box still hasn't been cleaned.
The brothers go to Disneyland.
Getting shot in the Old West while high.
Two surreal sequences.
Two cars encounter each other at a junkyard.
Going home after taking too much acid.
Weevil drops a tablet of acid in his own way.
A five-panel sequence showing the humorous effects of LSD-induced "enlightenment."
What happened when Robert dropped some acid in his hometown to become reacquainted with his childhood haunts.
Krishna, high on dope, explains to Judy, the neighbor's daughter what a newspaper headline about Timothy Leary means.
Rowdy pole vaults over a prison wall to get an LSD tablet into Timothy Leary's jail cell.
When Crumb and his wife took their first acid trip in 1965.
